name: FlowKit setup with multiple data providers.
tagline: A demonstration of FlowKit software used by a Non-Governmental Organisation with multiple Mobile Network Operators providing Call Detail Record.
body:
### Welcome to this demonstration of FlowKit software used by an NGO with multiple data providers.
This project is a collaboration of JIPS, FlowMinder and Alsenet in order to demonstrate possible ways to combine aggregated de-anonymised data from multiple data providers such as CDR data provided by multiple MNOs. 

### Results

* [Out flows above normal for Smart Telecom](https://jips-org.github.io/multi-mno-flowkit.github.io/smart_outflows_above_normal.html)
* [Out flows above normal for Ncell ](https://jips-org.github.io/multi-mno-flowkit.github.io/ncell_outflows_above_normal.html)
* [Out flows above normal for Nepal Telecom](https://jips-org.github.io/multi-mno-flowkit.github.io/ntc_outflows_above_normal.html)
* [Out flows above normal combined](https://jips-org.github.io/multi-mno-flowkit.github.io/outflows_above_normal.html)


### Code and deployment documentation

### Authors and Contributors
@WilhelminaWelsch from [JIPS](JIPS.org), @greenape (Jonathan Gray) from [FlowMinder](Flowminder.org), @bewakes (Bibek Pandey
) from [ToggleCorp](https://www.togglecorp.com/) and @polto (Alexandre Poltorak) from [Alsenet SA](https://github.com/alsenet-labs)

### Support or Contact
Having trouble troubles deploying this workflow ? Check out our [documentation](https://github.com/jips-org/adsm/) and do not hesitate to [contact FlowMinder](https://web.flowminder.org/) and/or [JIPS](https://www.jips.org/).
